phylo3D.trees
Class TreeWalrus

java.lang.Object
  phylo3D.trees.Tree
      phylo3D.trees.TreeWalrus
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class TreeWalrus
extends Tree

Class implementing functionality for printing out a LibSea format representation of TreeNCBI so that the TreeNCBI can be visualised using the hyperbolic tree visualisation program Walrus. Most of the methods in this class are related to producing the LibSea format with the data supplied by a TreeNCBI object. For details of the LibSea format see the Walrus website.

Author:
Tim Hughes (Computational Biology Unit - University of Bergen - Norway)
See Also:
Serialized Form

instantiateNode

protected NodeData instantiateNode(java.lang.Object o)
Specified by:
instantiateNode in class Tree

computeWalrusIDs

private void computeWalrusIDs()
Computes the walrusIDs for the all siblingGroups in this tree. These IDs are necessary because of the particularities of the LibSea format. A call to this method is made just before creating a String representation of the Walrus tree.

stringRepresentation

public java.lang.String stringRepresentation()
                                      throws FatalException
Produces a String representation of this class which is the LibSea format representation of a tree. This method makes a call to the the computeWalrusIDs() method.

Throws:
FatalException
See Also:
Object.toString()

private static java.lang.String tabOut(java.lang.String text,

Tabs out a piece of text by inserting \t a specified number of times at the begin of each new line.

Parameters:

Returns:
String the tabbed out text

metadata

private java.lang.String metadata(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String description,
                                  int numNodes,
                                  int numLinks,
                                  int numPaths,
                                  int numPathLinks)
Produces the metadata part of the LibSea file.

Parameters:
name - String name of tree
description - String description of the tree
numNodes - int number of siblingGroups in the tree
numLinks - int number of links in the tree
numPaths - int number of paths in the tree (not used by Walrus)
numPathLinks - int number of path links (not used by Walrus)
Returns:
String holding metadata

structuraldata

private java.lang.String structuraldata()
Produces the structural data part of the LibSea file id est the list of links that the tree consists of (the siblingGroups are not explicitly represented in the LibSea format).

Returns:
String holding structural data

attributedata

private java.lang.String attributedata()
                                throws FatalException
Produces the attribute data section of the LibSea file. This includes spanning tree definition, color attribute definition, node name definition and node rank definition.

Returns:
String with attribute data
Throws:
FatalException

produceLibseaColourCoding

public static int produceLibseaColourCoding(java.awt.Color colour)
LibSea encodes coloring attribute values as int according to a formula implemented in this method

Parameters:
colour - Color that needs to be encoded
Returns:
int encoding the colour using LibSea's representation

colorSubtreeBranches

public void colorSubtreeBranches(NodeData nd,
                                 java.awt.Color colour,
                                 boolean colourSubtreeRootBranch)
Ensures that the color attribute value for all siblingGroups in the specified subtree have the specified value

Parameters:
nd - NodeData node which is the root of the subtree to be coloured
colour - Color to be used to colour the subtree
colourSubtreeRootBranch - boolean indicating whether the to colour the branch leading to the root of the subtree
